domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Gardeners' World
entity.description: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

entity.description: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

If you've not caught it already, give your ears and minds a treat with a #LondonRiversWeek2020 @ThamesEstPart podcast special with me and lovely colleagues from @Thames21 @EnvAgency @SE_Rivers_Trust thanks to our talented Estuary Edges officer @eveasanders 🌊💙👇 https://t.co/B9bWxPUe47

@ThamesPathNT @emilyjanelovell @ThamesEstPart @EnvAgencySE @LondonPortAuth @Thames21 @eveasanders Wow! That's an amazing photo! The Estuary Edge reed bed and Thames foreshore look particularly lovely 💙

@jamespearson88 @herdyshepherd1 @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA As an American (and environmentalist) I am astonished that topsoil conservation isn’t an inherent goal of all farmers. Obv, soil, geology & rainfall vary widely, but to learn this is a common problem 😱. Can’t get that good friable soil back.

text: @Leicester_News was the first city in UK to enforce a lock down. judging by this rat I took a picture of at Abbey Park today Leicester might have another first in a few hundred years!! any one for bubonic plague ? @EnvAgency https://t.co/dL5IzARiCw

@jamespearson88 @herdyshepherd1 @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA they won't need to go in the fields in Weetabix county to do te sampling. The farmers there like to smear their fields on roads like a serving suggestion. 
Then get all arsey when you take them up on the offer and do offroading in the field b/c you slid on their mud.

@jamespearson88 @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA See it often this time of year in North Yorkshire. Don't know what the answer is but soil is a finite resource and should be retained, if we keep in like this it will run out one day.
